backend/main.mo: Minimal Motoko canister defining an empty actor.
feature_evidence.json: Lists implemented EMI history features, associated files, components, and test IDs with high confidence.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Prewritten summaries of key frontend files including components, hooks, utilities, and styling.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind base and theme variables defining color tokens and global styles with light/dark mode support.
frontend/index.html: Basic HTML shell loading the React app through main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main layout component rendering header, EMI calculator content, and footer.
frontend/src/components/EmiCalculator.ts: Full EMI calculator UI with validation, computation, tenure units, formatted output, and integrated history management.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: React hook creating and managing an authenticated or anonymous backend actor with react-query.
frontend/src/hooks/useEmiCalculationHist: Hook managing EMI calculation history with localStorage persistence, add/clear operations, and entry retrieval.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Context and hooks for Internet Identity authentication, handling login, logout, and identity persistence.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Placeholder file indicating no backend queries are needed for EMI calculations.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind theme variables and global styles using warm neutral backgrounds and emerald accents with dark mode.
frontend/src/lib/emi.ts: Provides an EMI calculator using the standard formula, returning monthly EMI, total payment, and interest with validation.
frontend/src/lib/format.ts: Contains number-formatting helpers for currency and integer display using Intl.NumberFormat.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstraps the React app with React Query and Internet Identity provider wrappers.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration extending theme settings, colors, animations, and enabling plugins.
project_state.json: JSON metadata describing project state, features, issues, and EMI calculator requirements.
